entry.title: Van E. Chandler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the age of 19, Van E. Chandler (pictured) was the youngest pilot in the United States Armed Forces to become a flying ace during World War II?

entry.title: Peasant Farm Policy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Canadian government implemented the Peasant Farm Policy to force First Nations farmers to use the methods of European peasants?

entry.title: C. J. Okoye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first organized football game of C. J. Okoye's life was in the National Football League?

entry.title: a strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a number of bus drivers who participated in a strike were unaware that it was illegally held?

entry.title: earliest-known Jewish writer in the Americas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the earliest-known Jewish writer in the Americas was the nephew of a conquistador?

entry.title: Hot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the song "Hot" features samples of car alarms?

entry.title: Moran Zer Katzenstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Moran Zer Katzenstein led a women's march inspired by The Handmaid's Tale in protest of Israeli judicial reform?

entry.title: Triodia scintillans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the spiky inedible grass Triodia scintillans tastes like salt and vinegar chips?
